161
Basic Propositional Connectives
Actually, in analyzing arguments we have been defining new logical con-
nectives without thinking about it much. For example, “not both pand q” was
symbolized as “~(p& q).” “Neither pnor q” was symbolized as “~(pq).” Let
us look more closely at the example “~(pq).” Perhaps we should have sym-
bolized it as “~p& ~q.” In fact, we could have used this symboliza
